action.action-desc: Mr. Kuhl of New York (for himself, Mr. Matheson, and Mr. Abercrombie) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the National Dam Safety Program Act.

section.header: Short title; amendment of National Dam Safety Program Act

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Dam Safety Act of 2006.

subsection.header: Amendment of National Dam Safety Program Act
subsection.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or a repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the National Dam Safety Program Act (33 U.S.C. 467 et seq.).

paragraph.text: The term State Regulated Dam means a State dam subject to the criteria described in section 8(e)(2)(A)(i), (iv) and (vi).

section.text: Section 3(a)(2) is amended by striking Power and inserting Energy Regulatory.
Section 6 is amended to read as follows:

The Secretary of the Army, acting through the Chief of Engineers, shall maintain and update information on the inventory of dams in the United States. Such inventory of dams shall include an assessment of each dam based on inspections completed by either a Federal agency or a State dam safety agency.

subsection.text: Section 8(b)(1) is amended by striking and target dates to and inserting performance measures and target dates toward effectively administering the Act in order to.

subsection.header: Assistance for State dam safety programs

paragraph.text: striking clause (iv) and inserting the following:

subclause.text: the authority to require or perform the inspection at least once every 5 years, of all dams and reservoirs that would pose a significant threat to human life and property in case of failure to determine the continued safety of the dams and reservoirs;
authority to require or perform inspection at least every 5 years of those dams and reservoirs that pose a significant threat to human life and property; and
a procedure for more detailed and frequent safety inspections;

paragraph.text: in clause (vi) by inserting install and monitor instrumentation, after remedial work,.

section.text: Section 13 is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to FEMA to carry out sections 7, 8, and 11 (in addition to any amounts made available for similar purposes included in any other Act and amounts made available under subsections (b) through (e)), $8,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2007 through 2011, to remain available until expended.

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraphs (B) and (C), for each fiscal year, amounts made available under this subsection to carry out section 8 shall be allocated among the states as follows:

clause.text: One-third among States that qualify for assistance under section 8(e).
Two-thirds among States that qualify for assistance under section 8(e), to each State in proportion to—

subclause.text: the number of dams in the State that are listed as State-regulated dams on the inventory of dams maintained under section 6; as compared to
the number of dams in all States that are listed as State-regulated dams on the inventory of dams maintained under section 6.

subparagraph.text: The amount of funds allocated to a State under this paragraph may not exceed 50 percent of the reasonable cost of implementing the State dam safety program.
The Director and the Board shall determine the amount allocated to States.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out section 6 $1,000,000 for each fiscal year.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out Section 9 $2,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2007 through 2011, to remain until expended.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out section 10 $700,000 for each of fiscal years 2007 through 2011.

There is authorized to be appropriated to FEMA for the employment of such additional staff personnel as are necessary to carry out sections 8 through 10 $1,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2007 through 2011.
Amounts made available under this Act may not be used to construct or repair any Federal or non-Federal dam.
